name: Odin
explanation: Odin is the Norse Allfather who sacrificed an eye for wisdom. Marvel brought him to the big screen as Thor's father, ruler of Asgard.

name: Thor
explanation: Thor is the Norse god of thunder wielding Mjölnir. Marvel made him an Avenger and Chris Hemsworth made hammers sexy.

name: Freya
explanation: Freya is the Norse goddess of love, beauty, and war who rides a chariot pulled by cats.

name: Tyr
explanation: Týr is the Norse god of war who lost his hand to Fenrir, and also a Faroese folk metal band.

name: Baldur
explanation: Baldur is the Norse god of light and purity, killed by mistletoe due to Loki's trickery.

name: Heimdall
explanation: Heimdall is the Norse guardian of Bifröst who sees across all realms. Idris Elba played him in the MCU running Asgard's border security.

name: Frigg
explanation: Frigg is Odin's wife and the Norse goddess of marriage and motherhood.

name: Hel
explanation: Hel is the Norse goddess of the underworld, daughter of Loki, half alive and half dead.

name: Fenrir
explanation: Fenrir is the monstrous Norse wolf destined to kill Odin at Ragnarök, and also multiple metal bands.

name: Zeus
explanation: Zeus is the Greek king of the gods, ruler of Mount Olympus and god of thunder.

name: Apollo
explanation: Apollo is the Greek/Roman sun god, NASA's legendary moon landing program, Apollo GraphQL, and the Buick Apollo.

name: Athena
explanation: Athena is the Greek goddess of wisdom and warfare born from Zeus's head, and AWS Athena is a serverless SQL query service.

name: Poseidon
explanation: Poseidon is the Greek god of the sea, earthquakes, and horses.

name: Hades
explanation: Hades is the Greek god of the underworld and ruler of the dead.

name: Ares
explanation: Ares is the Greek god of war. DC made him Wonder Woman's archnemesis - she literally killed him in the 2017 film.

name: Hercules
explanation: Hercules (Greek: Heracles) is the legendary demigod known for his twelve labors. Marvel's been publishing Hercules comics since the 60s - he's basically the OG superhero.

name: Hermes
explanation: Hermes is the Greek messenger god, also patron of thieves, travelers, and commerce.

name: Artemis
explanation: Artemis is the Greek moon goddess and Apollo's twin sister. NASA named their return-to-Moon program after her - the mythological sequel we needed.

name: Aphrodite
explanation: Aphrodite is the Greek goddess of love and beauty, born from sea foam.

name: Dionysus
explanation: Dionysus is the Greek god of wine, festivity, and religious ecstasy.

name: Atlas
explanation: Atlas is the Greek Titan holding up the sky, the Atlas rocket family that launched Moon missions, MongoDB Atlas, the VW Atlas, a Saturn moon, and multiple Marvel/DC heroes.

name: Pegasus
explanation: Pegasus is the Greek winged horse born from Medusa's blood, the Pegasus air-launched rocket, and a prominent northern constellation.

name: Centaur
explanation: Centaurs are Greek half-human half-horse creatures, the Centaur rocket upper stage (first to use liquid hydrogen), and a playable race in D&D.

name: Psyche
explanation: Psyche is the Greek goddess of the soul who married Eros, a metal-rich asteroid that may be a planetary core, and NASA's mission to explore it (arriving 2029).

name: Gemini
explanation: Gemini means 'twins' for Castor and Pollux in Greek myth, NASA's two-astronaut program (1961-1966), the zodiac constellation, and Gemini Syndrome hard rock band.

name: Cassandra
explanation: Cassandra was a Greek prophetess cursed to never be believed, and also an Apache distributed database.

name: Pandora
explanation: Pandora opened the box releasing evils into the world, a music streaming service, and a moon of Saturn.

name: Jupiter
explanation: Jupiter is the Roman king of the gods, and the largest planet in our solar system.

name: Mars
explanation: Mars is the Roman god of war, the 'Red Planet', and Mars Black/Red/Yellow are iron oxide pigments.

name: Venus
explanation: Venus is the Roman goddess of love, and the second planet from the Sun.

name: Neptune
explanation: Neptune is the Roman god of the sea, and the eighth planet from the Sun.

name: Mercury
explanation: Mercury is the Roman messenger god, the closest planet, NASA's first human spaceflight program (1958-1963), and Ford's Mercury car brand (1938-2011).

name: Vulcan
explanation: Vulcan is the Roman god of fire and the forge. ULA's Vulcan Centaur rocket (2024) is named for him - fitting for something that produces spectacular flames.

name: Minerva
explanation: Minerva is the Roman goddess of wisdom, equivalent to the Greek Athena.

name: Juno
explanation: Juno is the Roman queen of the gods and Jupiter's wife. NASA's Juno spacecraft has orbited Jupiter since 2016 - who better to peer through the clouds and see what Jupiter is up to?

name: Ceres
explanation: Ceres is the Roman goddess of agriculture, and also the largest object in the asteroid belt - a dwarf planet discovered in 1801.

name: Pluto
explanation: Pluto is the Roman god of the underworld, and the dwarf planet in our solar system.

name: Morrigan
explanation: The Morrígan is the Celtic goddess of war, fate, and death, often appearing as a crow.

name: Brigid
explanation: Brigid is the Celtic goddess of fire, poetry, and smithcraft.

name: Cernunnos
explanation: Cernunnos is the Celtic horned god of nature, animals, and fertility.

name: Danu
explanation: Danu is the Celtic mother goddess, ancestor of the Tuatha Dé Danann.

name: Lugh
explanation: Lugh is the Celtic god of skill, crafts, and many talents.

name: Dagda
explanation: The Dagda is the Celtic father god with a magic club and cauldron of plenty.

name: Epona
explanation: Epona is the Celtic goddess of horses, and Link's iconic horse companion in The Legend of Zelda series since Ocarina of Time.

name: Daedalus
explanation: Daedalus is the Greek mythological master craftsman and father of Icarus, and also the official Cardano cryptocurrency wallet.

name: Triton
explanation: Triton is the Greek merman god, NVIDIA's GPU programming language, a D&D race, and Neptune's largest moon.

name: Medusa
explanation: Medusa is the Greek Gorgon with snake hair, an open-source commerce platform, and a classic D&D monster type.

name: Cerberus
explanation: Cerberus is the three-headed dog of Greek myth, an Android security app, and appears in D&D's Nine Hells.

name: Hyperion
explanation: Hyperion is the Greek Titan of light, Apache Big Data platform, and a moon of Saturn.

name: Chronos
explanation: Chronos is the Greek personification of Time, and also a distributed cron job scheduler by Airbnb.

name: Morpheus
explanation: Morpheus is the Greek god of dreams, and also NVIDIA's cybersecurity AI framework.

name: Talos
explanation: Talos is the Greek mythological bronze automaton protecting Crete, and also Cisco's threat intelligence organization.

name: Helios
explanation: Helios is the Greek god of the Sun, LinkedIn's search platform, and refers to the Sun itself.

name: Hera
explanation: Hera is the Greek queen of the gods, and also a workflow orchestration SDK for Argo Workflows.

name: Kraken
explanation: The Kraken is a legendary Norse sea monster, a major crypto exchange, and a powerful D&D monster.

name: Icarus
explanation: Icarus is the Greek figure who flew too close to the sun, and also Icarus Verilog, a hardware simulation tool.

name: Titan
explanation: The Titans are primordial Greek gods, Google's TPU, the Nissan Titan, Saturn's largest moon with liquid methane lakes, the Titan rocket family, and the Teen Titans.

name: Sleipnir
explanation: Sleipnir is Odin's eight-legged horse in Norse mythology, and also a Japanese web browser.

name: Lambda
explanation: Lambda is the 11th Greek letter, a core concept in functional programming (lambda calculus), and AWS Lambda is a serverless computing service.

name: Alpha
explanation: Alpha is the first Greek letter, Google's parent Alphabet, Tesla's alpha software releases, and the Alfa Romeo car brand. Also the first COVID variant of concern.

name: Beta
explanation: Beta is the second Greek letter, a software testing phase ('beta release'), and fundamental to Silicon Valley product culture. Also a notable COVID variant.

name: Delta
explanation: Delta is the fourth Greek letter (triangle symbol), the Lancia Delta rally car, Delta Air Lines, the math symbol for change, and the infamous COVID variant.

name: Omega
explanation: Omega is the final Greek letter meaning 'the end', the Oldsmobile Omega, Omega watches, and Omega is a Hungarian prog rock band. 'Alpha and Omega' means beginning and end.

name: Sigma
explanation: Sigma is the 18th Greek letter meaning 'sum' in mathematics, Six Sigma quality methodology, Sigma camera lenses, and the internet 'sigma male' meme.

name: Pi
explanation: Pi is the 16th Greek letter representing 3.14159... - the mathematical constant, and the Raspberry Pi single-board computer revolutionizing DIY electronics.

name: Tau
explanation: Tau is the 19th Greek letter, the Tau Empire is a major high-tech faction in Warhammer 40k, and tau represents 2*pi advocated by some as superior to pi.

name: Kappa
explanation: Kappa is the 10th Greek letter, the famous Twitch emote for sarcasm (the grey face), and statistics' kappa coefficient measures inter-rater agreement.

name: Valkyrie
explanation: Valkyries are Norse maidens who choose the slain for Valhalla, D&D celestials, the Aston Martin hypercar, and Tessa Thompson's hard-drinking warrior queen in the MCU.

name: Mjolnir
explanation: Mjolnir is Thor's hammer in Norse mythology, forged by dwarves and capable of leveling mountains.

name: Yggdrasil
explanation: Yggdrasil is the World Tree in Norse mythology, and also a Linux distribution.

name: Ragnarok
explanation: Ragnarok is the Norse apocalypse, the twilight of the gods where Odin dies fighting Fenrir.

name: Asgard
explanation: Asgard is the realm of the Norse gods, connected to Earth by the Bifröst bridge.

name: Bifrost
explanation: Bifröst is the rainbow bridge to Asgard in Norse myth, and also a remote access tool.

name: Valhalla
explanation: Valhalla is the Norse hall of the slain, where warriors who die in battle feast with Odin until Ragnarok.

name: Jormungandr
explanation: Jormungandr is the Norse World Serpent who encircles Midgard, appearing as a monster in D&D.

name: Bacchus
explanation: Bacchus is the Roman god of wine and ecstasy, equivalent to the Greek Dionysus.

name: Diana
explanation: Diana is the Roman goddess of the hunt and moon, equivalent to the Greek Artemis.

name: Saturn
explanation: Saturn is the Roman god of time, the Sega Saturn, the ringed planet, the mighty Saturn V Moon rocket, and GM's Saturn car brand (1985-2010).

name: Cupid
explanation: Cupid is the Roman god of love, equivalent to Greek Eros, often depicted with bow and arrows.

name: Flora
explanation: Flora is the Roman goddess of flowers and spring, celebrated during the Floralia festival.

name: Fortuna
explanation: Fortuna is the Roman goddess of fortune and luck, often depicted with a wheel.

name: Vesta
explanation: Vesta is the Roman goddess of the hearth served by the Vestal Virgins, and the Opel/Vauxhall Vesta subcompact car.

name: Janus
explanation: Janus is the Roman two-faced god of doorways, beginnings, and endings. January is named after him.

name: Nuada
explanation: Nuada is the Celtic god-king of the Tuatha Dé Danann, who lost his hand in battle.

name: Taranis
explanation: Taranis is the Celtic god of thunder, depicted with a wheel and lightning.

name: Ogma
explanation: Ogma is the Celtic god of eloquence and learning, who invented the Ogham alphabet.

name: Manannán
explanation: Manannán mac Lir is the Celtic sea god, ruler of the otherworldly islands.

name: Belenus
explanation: Belenus is the Celtic sun god, associated with healing and honored at Beltane.

name: Arianrhod
explanation: Arianrhod is the Celtic goddess of the moon and stars, keeper of the Silver Wheel.

name: Rhiannon
explanation: Rhiannon is a Celtic goddess of horses and the otherworld, and also a famous Fleetwood Mac song.

name: Balor
explanation: Balor is the Celtic one-eyed giant king of the Fomorians, similar to D&D's Balor demons.

name: Sucellos
explanation: Sucellos is the Celtic god of agriculture and forests, wielding a long-handled hammer.

name: Andraste
explanation: Andraste is the Celtic goddess of victory, invoked by Boudica before battle.

name: Mabon
explanation: Mabon is the Welsh divine son, associated with the autumn equinox festival.

name: Aengus
explanation: Aengus is the Celtic god of love, youth, and poetic inspiration, son of the Dagda.

name: Odyssey
explanation: The Odyssey is Homer's epic poem about Odysseus's journey, and the Honda Odyssey minivan.

name: Avalon
explanation: Avalon is the mythical island where King Arthur was taken after his final battle, and the Toyota Avalon sedan.

name: Aurora
explanation: Aurora is the Roman goddess of the dawn, the Oldsmobile Aurora sedan, and the aurora borealis phenomenon.

name: Eos
explanation: Eos is the Greek goddess of the dawn, and the Volkswagen Eos retractable hardtop convertible.

name: Phaeton
explanation: Phaeton was the son of Helios who crashed the sun chariot, and the Volkswagen Phaeton luxury sedan.

name: Electra
explanation: Electra was a Greek princess in tragedies by Sophocles, the Buick Electra, and Marvel's Elektra Natchios - Daredevil's deadly assassin ex (spelled with a K).

name: Fury
explanation: The Furies (Erinyes) were Greek goddesses of vengeance, the Plymouth Fury muscle car, and Nick Fury runs SHIELD in Marvel (with his iconic eyepatch).

name: Orion
explanation: Orion is the iconic hunter constellation, the Greek giant huntsman, the Ford Orion, and NASA's crew capsule for Artemis Moon missions.

name: Nova
explanation: A nova is a stellar explosion, the Chevrolet Nova muscle car, and Marvel's Nova Corps - cosmic heroes led by Richard Rider protecting the galaxy.

name: Vega
explanation: Vega is the fifth-brightest star in the night sky, the Chevrolet Vega compact car, and AMD's GPU architecture.

name: Polaris
explanation: Polaris is the North Star used for navigation, AMD's GPU architecture, and the Polaris vehicle brand.

name: Sirius
explanation: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky (the 'Dog Star'), and Sirius XM satellite radio.

name: Andromeda
explanation: Andromeda is our nearest large galaxy, the Greek princess chained to a rock, and a Swedish death metal band.

name: Equinox
explanation: The equinox is when day and night are equal length, and the Chevrolet Equinox crossover SUV.

name: Solstice
explanation: The solstice marks the longest and shortest days of the year, and the Pontiac Solstice roadster.

name: Corona
explanation: The corona is the Sun's outer atmosphere visible during eclipses, and the Toyota Corona sedan.

name: Pulsar
explanation: A pulsar is a rotating neutron star emitting radio wave beams, and the Nissan Pulsar compact car.

name: Quasar
explanation: A quasar is an extremely bright galactic nucleus powered by a supermassive black hole, and a Vue.js framework.

name: Voyager
explanation: NASA's twin Voyager spacecraft (1977) are the most distant human-made objects in interstellar space, and Voyager is an Australian prog metal band that competed in Eurovision 2023.

name: Cassini
explanation: The Cassini-Huygens mission studied Saturn for 13 years before plunging into the planet. Named after Giovanni Cassini who discovered the gap in Saturn's rings.

name: Dawn
explanation: NASA's Dawn spacecraft was the first to orbit two extraterrestrial bodies (Vesta and Ceres), exploring the 'dawn of the solar system'.

name: Comet
explanation: Comets are icy bodies orbiting the Sun with distinctive tails, and the Mercury Comet classic car.

name: Meteor
explanation: A meteor is a space rock burning in Earth's atmosphere (shooting star), and Meteor.js web framework.

name: Nebula
explanation: A nebula is an interstellar cloud where stars form, and Nebula is Thanos's cyborg daughter and reluctant Guardian of the Galaxy in Marvel.

name: Europa
explanation: Europa is Jupiter's icy moon possibly harboring life, the Greek princess Zeus abducted as a bull, and NASA's Europa Clipper mission (arriving 2030).

name: Ganymede
explanation: Ganymede is the largest moon in the solar system (Jupiter's moon), named after Zeus's cupbearer.

name: Callisto
explanation: Callisto is Jupiter's second-largest moon, named after the Greek nymph transformed into a bear by Hera.

name: Io
explanation: Io is Jupiter's volcanic moon, named after the priestess of Hera whom Zeus transformed into a cow.
